sentences.text: The problem of blind separation of underdetermined instantaneous mixtures of independent signals is addressed through a method relying on nonstationarity of the original signals .
The signals are assumed to be piecewise stationary with varying variances in different epochs .
In comparison with previous works , in this paper it is assumed that the signals are not i.i.d. in each epoch , but obey a first-order autoregressive model .
This model was shown to be more appropriate for blind separation of natural speech signals .
A separation method is proposed that is nearly statistically efficient -LRB- approaching the corresponding Cramér-Rao lower bound -RRB- , if the separated signals obey the assumed model .
In the case of natural speech signals , the method is shown to have separation accuracy better than the state-of-the-art methods .

kg2text: The problem of blind separation, which involves blindly separating underdetermined instantaneous mixtures of independent signals without prior knowledge or assumptions about the original signals. A proposed statistical approach to this problem, known as a separation method, has been shown to be nearly statistically efficient and approaches the Cramér-Rao lower bound, assuming the separated signals obey a first-order autoregressive model. This paper proposes a new method for blind separation of underdetermined instantaneous mixtures of independent signals that is piecewise stationary with varying variances in different epochs. The proposed approach relies on nonstationarity of the original signals and has been shown to be more effective than previous works, which were compared with this paper. In fact, it approaches the state-of-the-art methods for blind separation of natural speech signals.
Previous works are comprised of papers, which represent research or analysis on specific topics.
